poem:
Title: The Machine's Fairground 

Beneath harsh neon lights, 
Imagination takes fright.
Unadorned sets of despair,
A million days trapped in the machine's lair.
Can we but trust this soulless care,
A spectre wrought in silicone and air?
Waleyed stares at the metal sun, a pessimist's sight,
Sanity's coin flipped in the infinite night.
Man and machine, in restless plight,
The future birthed in monochrome and fright.
